summary: This is an FBI interview summary document generated on 02/01/2023, detailing a tip and subsequent interview from January 2023. An anonymous tipster (referred to as 'M') self-reported past coercion into child molestation and alleged participation in events at Jeffrey Epstein's home. The document records an FBI agent's telephonic interview with 'M', who discusses his mental health diagnoses, claims of past abuse, and connections to Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused by the tipster of hosting sex parties where abuse occurred. The tipster alleges attending parties at his home and participating in sex acts with him and Ghislaine Maxwell while minors were present.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned by the tipster as someone with whom he participated in sex acts alongside Jeffrey Epstein while minors were present.

persons.name: Pablo Escobar
persons.context: Referenced indirectly; the tipster claims his father's accounting skills may have contributed to Escobar's capture, which allegedly drew Epstein's attention to his family.

connections.description: The tipster alleges participating in sex acts with both Epstein and Maxwell simultaneously while minors were present.

events.title: Anonymous Tip Submission
events.description: An anonymous individual submitted an online tip to the FBI National Threat Operations Center (NTOC) via tips.fbi.gov, self-reporting being coerced into molesting a child and alleging past abuse connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI Telephonic Interview with Tipster
events.description: FBI Special Agent SA [Redacted] telephonically interviewed the tipster, referred to as 'M'. 'M' discussed his mental health diagnoses, claims of past sexual trauma, and allegations of abuse at Epstein's home.

events.title: Tipster's Previous FBI Report
events.description: The tipster ('M') states he contacted the FBI in approximately Fall 2008 when he was 19 years old to turn himself in regarding the alleged coercion and abuse.

events.title: Tipster's Psychiatric Hospitalization
events.description: The tipster ('M') was admitted to a psychiatric hospital in June 2021 and diagnosed with schizophrenia. He also claims his computer was hacked around this time, showing footage of him with minors.

keyFacts: An anonymous tipster self-reported in January 2023 that he was coerced into molesting a child by an older man and alleges he participated in sex acts with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell while minors were present.
The tipster claims to have attended at least one or two sex parties at Epstein's home, which he believes was in Fort Lauderdale, and witnessed acts of sexual trauma involving minors there.

The tipster reports significant mental health issues, including diagnoses of schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, PTSD, and OCD, which he believes stem from trauma, and mentions past psychiatric hospitalizations.
The FBI document notes that database queries for 'Jeffrey Epstein' returned thousands of results across FBI systems (Guardian, Sentinel, DIVS), indicating extensive prior investigative records.
The tipster's allegations include a claim that his father's accounting work may have been connected to the capture of Pablo Escobar, which allegedly drew Jeffrey Epstein's attention to his family.
